abstract_summ: The analytical curve is fitted to data in Belgium, France, New York City and Switzerland, with a correlation coefficient exceeding 98.8%, suggesting that finer models are unnecessary with such macroscopic data.From the pandemic scenario of COVID-19 disease cases in all over the world, the outbreak prediction becomes very complex for the emerging scientifically research.We present a simple analytical model to describe the fast increase of deaths produced by the corona virus (COVID-19) infections.Using the classical Susceptible-Infected-Recovered epidemiological model, an analytical formula is derived for the number of beds occupied by Covid-19 patients.The goal of this article is to analyze some compartmental models specially designed to model the spread of a disease whose transmission has the same features as COVID-19.
title_summ: Estimating the parameters of SIR model of COVID-19 cases in India during lock down periodsThe D model for deaths by COVID-19Susceptible-Infected-Recovered (SIR) Dynamics of COVID-19 and Economic ImpactHospitalization dynamics during the first COVID-19 pandemic wave: SIR modelling compared to Belgium, France, Italy, Switzerland and New York City dataRefined compartmental models, asymptomatic carriers and COVID-19
